lead_paragraph: Could an Indian Army helicopter's accidental foray into Pakistani territory Sunday afternoon have an unexpected effect - the improvement of relations between the two nations? After questioning the four-member Indian crew for nearly five hours, Pakistani officials released them at about 6 p.m.(Hindustan Times). India's Ministry of External Affairs said it "greatly appreciates the manner in which Pakistan worked with us" (The Hindu). India's gratitude for the swift return will be "expressed at the highest levels" when Prime Minister Manmohan Singh meets his counterpart Yousaf Raza Gillani in the Maldives next month, says the Times of India.

headline.main: Newswallah: In the English-Language Press Monday
